pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

struct Order {
    address token2sell;
    address token2buy;
    address beneficiary;
    address caller;
    uint256 amountLeft;
    uint256 token2buyAmount;
    uint64 creationTimestamp;
    uint8 discountType;
}

struct OrderWithId {
    Order order;
    uint256 orderId;
}

interface IExchange {
    /* ===================== ERRORS ===================== */
    error OnlyAdminError();
    error OrderExist(uint256 orderId);
    error OrderNotExist(uint256 orderId);
    error IncorrectToken(address orderToken2buy, address inToken);
    error SmallAmountLeft();
    error BadOutAmount();
    error UserIsNotBeneficiary();
    error IsNotTopStaker(address staker);
    error IsNotStaker(address staker);
    error OrderNotForThisStaker(uint256 orderId, address staker);
    error NotEnoughReturnValue();
    error CallbackError();
    error ZeroPriceError();
    error InvalidDiscountType();
    error InvalidAddress();
    error InvalidTokens();
    error InvalidAmount();
    error IsNotWhitelisted();
    error MaxDiscountTooHigh();
    error NoStakersAvailable();
    error ZeroRecipient();

    /* ======================== EVENTS ========================= */
    event PriceCurveChanged();
    event OrderAdded(uint256 orderId);
    event OrderCanceled(uint256 orderId);
    event OrderFilled(uint256 orderId);
    event OrderFilledPartially(uint256 orderId);
    event LpOrdersAdded(address LPToken, uint256[] orderIds);
    event DustThresholdChanged(uint256 oldValue, uint256 newValue);
    event WhitelistUpdated(address user, bool isWhitelisted);
    event MaxDiscountPercentChanged(uint256 oldMaxDiscountPercent, uint256 newMaxDiscountPercent);
    event EmergencyWithdraw(address indexed token, address indexed recipient, uint256 amount);

    /* ==================== MUTABLE METHODS ==================== */

    /**
      * @notice Add order to swap {token2sell} to {token2buy}.
      * @dev This swap is async, because depends on how arbitrage bots will fill this order. Emits OrderAdded() event.
      * Before addOrder user needs to approve token2sell for exchange contract
      * @param token2sell - Address of token to sell
      * @param amount2sell - Amount of {token2sell} to sell
      * @param token2buy - Address of token to buy
      * @param beneficiary - Address that will receive {token2buy} after filling order.
      * @param discountType - Speed of decreasing swap price. { 0 - aggressive, 1 - middle, 2 - conservative }
      * @param collateralJoin - address of collateral adapter
     **/
    function addOrder (
        address token2sell,
        uint256 amount2sell,
        address token2buy,
        address beneficiary,
        uint8 discountType,
        address collateralJoin
    ) external returns (uint256);

    /**
      * @notice Only user who place order or who is beneficiary can cancelOrder();
      * @param orderId - Id of order to cancel.
     **/
    function cancelOrder (uint256 orderId) external;

    /**
      * @notice Fill order with flash-loan like logic
      * @dev Caller contract receive orders {token2sell} and after that his stableunitFillOrderCallback() is called.
      * At the end of thi callback contract should send some amount of another token back to Exchange contract.
      * @dev We don't need slippage protection because:
      * 1. Prices are determined by Oracle, not DEX market conditions
      * 2. Output amount is calculated deterministically at execution time
      * @param orderId - Id of order to fill.
      * @param inAmount - Amount of {token2sell} to receive
      * @param data - encoded data to pass to callback function
     **/
    function fillOrderAsFlashLoan (
        uint256 orderId,
        uint256 inAmount,
        bytes memory data
    ) external returns (uint256 outAmount);

    /**
      * @notice Fill order without a flash-loan
      * @dev Caller contract send tokens and receive another tokens depends on the order
      * @param orderId - Id of order to fill.
      * @param inAmount - Amount of {token2sell} to receive
     **/
    function fillOrderSimple(uint256 orderId, uint256 inAmount) external returns (uint256 outAmount);

    /**
     * @notice Updates the maximum allowed discount percentage for all order types
     * @dev This function can only be called by the contract owner
     * @param newMaxDiscountPercent New maximum discount value (in percentage points).
     *        Value is bounded to 90% to prevent configuration mistakes
     */
    function setMaxDiscountPercent(uint256 newMaxDiscountPercent) external;

    /**
      * @notice Add or remove user from whitelist
      * @param user - address of user
      * @param isWhitelisted - bool, false if we want to remove, true if we want to add user to whitelist.
     **/
    function updateWhitelistUser(address user, bool isWhitelisted) external;

    /**
      * @notice Function to update price curve - how fast {token2sell} price will decrease/increase
      * @param discountType - discount type to change
      * @param newPriceCurve - parameters of formula
     **/
    function setPriceCurve(uint8 discountType, uint256[2] calldata newPriceCurve) external;

    /**
      * @notice Function to update dust threshold
      * @param newThreshold - new dust threshold
     **/
    function setDustThreshold(uint256 newThreshold) external;

    /* ==================== VIEW METHODS ==================== */
    /**
      * @return The amount of outcome that caller will receive if he will fill {orderId} with {inAmount} of {token2sell}
     **/
    function getExpectedOrderOutcome (uint256 orderId, uint256 inAmount) external view returns (uint256);

    /**
      * @return Order with id = {orderId}
     **/
    function getOrder (uint256 orderId) external view returns (Order memory);

    /**
      * @return The amount of not full-filled orders
     **/
    function getOrdersCount () external view returns (uint256);

    /**
      * @return The array of all not-filled orders. May be deleted after adding GraphQL for orderIds
     **/
    function getAllOrders (uint256 offset, uint256 limit) external view returns (OrderWithId[] memory);

    /**
     * @notice Returns the address of the staker assigned to an order during grace period
     * @param orderId The ID of the order to check
     * @return assignedStaker The address of the assigned staker, or zero address if:
     *         - Order doesn't exist
     *         - Order is past grace period
     *         - No top stakers available
     */
    function getAssignedStaker(uint256 orderId) external view returns (address);

    /**
  * @notice Emergency withdraw in case contract have some tokens, that can be transferred by default functions
     **/
    function emergencyWithdraw(address token, address recipient, uint256 amount) external;
}

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

/**
 * @title SuAccessRoles Library
 * @dev SuAuthenticated and SuAccessControlSingleton need to have this constants
 * Hierarchy:
 *      1. DAO - can give admins and system roles
 *      2.1. Admin - can set Alerters
 *      2.2. System - includes Minter, Liquidation, Reward and Disabler roles, don't have access to give some roles.
 *      3. Alerter - can send alerts and trigger rate limits, don't have access to give some roles.
 */
abstract contract SuAccessRoles {
    bytes32 public constant ADMIN_ROLE = 0x00;

    bytes32 public constant DAO_ROLE = keccak256("DAO_ROLE");

    bytes32 public constant ALERTER_ROLE = keccak256("ALERTER_ROLE");

    // system roles
    bytes32 public constant MINT_ACCESS_ROLE = keccak256("MINT_ACCESS_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant LIQUIDATION_ACCESS_ROLE = keccak256("LIQUIDATION_ACCESS_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant REWARD_ACCESS_ROLE = keccak256("REWARD_ACCESS_ROLE");
    // bytes32 public constant SYSTEM_ROLE = keccak256("SYSTEM_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant DISABLER_ROLE = keccak256("DISABLER_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant CDP_ACCESS_ROLE = keccak256("CDP_ACCESS_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant VOTING_ESCROW_ROLE = keccak256("VOTING_ESCROW_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant PROXY_ACTIONS_ROLE = keccak256("PROXY_ACTIONS_ROLE");
}
","keccak256":"0x76c6b55446c0e7b40405cd0b642650c64a842e5dd71d5c5307f0b2def8898a1b","license":"BSL 1.1"},"contracts/exchange/contracts/periphery/contracts/access-control/SuAuthenticated.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BSL 1.1

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

import "../interfaces/access-control/ISuAccessControl.sol";
import "./SuAccessRoles.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/introspection/IERC165Upgradeable.sol";

/**
 * @title SuAuthenticated
 * @dev other contracts should inherit to be authenticated.
 * The address of SuAccessControlSingleton should be one for all contract that inherits SuAuthenticated
 */
abstract contract SuAuthenticated is Initializable, SuAccessRoles, IERC165Upgradeable {
    ISuAccessControl public ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON;

    error OnlyDAOError();
    error OnlyAdminError();
    error OnlyAlerterError();
    error OnlyVaultAccessError();
    error OnlyLiquidationAccessError();
    error OnlyMintAccessError();
    error OnlyRewardAccessError();
    error OnlyDisablerAccessError();
    error OnlyVotingEscrowError();
    error OnlyProxyActionsError();
    error OnlyRoleError();
    error OnlyCDPAccessError();
    error BadAccessControlSingleton();

    /**
     * @dev should be passed in constructor
     */
    function __suAuthenticatedInit(address _accessControlSingleton) internal onlyInitializing {
        ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON = ISuAccessControl(_accessControlSingleton);
        if (
            _accessControlSingleton == address(0) ||
            !ISuAccessControl(_accessControlSingleton).supportsInterface(type(IAccessControlUpgradeable).interfaceId)
        ) revert BadAccessControlSingleton();
    }

    /** CORE ROLES */

    modifier onlyDAO() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(DAO_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyDAOError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyAdmin() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyAdminError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyAlerter() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(ALERTER_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyAlerterError();
        _;
    }

    /** SYSTEM ROLES */

    modifier onlyLiquidationAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(LIQUIDATION_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyLiquidationAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyMintAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(MINT_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyMintAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyRewardAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(REWARD_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyRewardAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyRewardOrAdminAccess() {
        if (
            !ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(REWARD_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender) &&
            !ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender)
        ) revert OnlyRewardAccessError();
        _;
    }

    // @notice This modifier check if user/contract have access to "disable" contracts.
    // All main contracts in our lending protocol have disableContract() method that stops contracts main functions.
    modifier onlyDisablerAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(DISABLER_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyDisablerAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyCDPAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(CDP_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyCDPAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyVotingEscrow() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(VOTING_ESCROW_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyVotingEscrowError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyProxyActions() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(PROXY_ACTIONS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyProxyActionsError();
        _;
    }

    // syntax sugar under ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON
    modifier onlyRole(bytes32 role) {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(role, msg.sender)) revert OnlyRoleError();
        _;
    }

    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual returns (bool) {
        return ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.supportsInterface(interfaceId);
    }

    uint256[50] private __gap;
}

import "../interfaces/ILiquidationEngine.sol";
import "../interfaces/ISafeEngine.sol";
import "../interfaces/ICollateralJoin.sol";
import "../../exchange/contracts/interfaces/IExchange.sol";
import "../../exchange/contracts/periphery/contracts/access-control/SuAuthenticated.sol";
import "../interfaces/IAccountingEngine.sol";

import {Math} from "../utils/Math.sol";

// CHANGED (from dog.sol): added Whitelist behaviour to add order correctly.
// Added SuAuthenticated instead of authorizedAccounts
// Added Math to move Math behaviour.
// Added interface and moved struct there.
// Added AddAuthorization call in constructor (can be removed).
// Added LiquidatorReward
// Moved Liquidator from CollateralType struct to global var, because it's one for all collaterals
// Calculate rewardCollateral in liquidateCDP
// Use addOrder instead of startAuction in liquidateCDP

/**
 * @title LiquidationEngine
 * @notice Manages Safe liquidations in the StableUnit protocol.
 * @dev Identifies undercollateralized Safes, confiscates collateral and debt, and auctions collateral via the Exchange
 *      module. Supports global and per-collateral-type liquidation limits, a liquidator reward, and a discount type for
 *      auctions. Integrates with SafeEngine for Safe operations and AccountingEngine for debt queuing. This contract is a
 *      fork of MakerDAO’s Dog.sol, adapted for StableUnit with Exchange-based auctions and a global liquidator.
 * @custom:usage
 * - **Initialization**: Deploy with access control and SafeEngine addresses.
 *   ```solidity
 *   LiquidationEngine liquidationEngine = new LiquidationEngine(accessControl, safeEngine);
 *   ```
 * - **Collateral Type Setup**: Configure liquidation parameters for a collateral type.
 *   ```solidity
 *   liquidationEngine.modifyParameters("ETH-A", "liquidationPenalty", penalty);
 *   liquidationEngine.modifyParameters("ETH-A", "liquidationLimit", limit);
 *   ```
 * - **Liquidation**: Liquidate an undercollateralized Safe.
 *   ```solidity
 *   uint orderId = liquidationEngine.liquidateCDP("ETH-A", safeAddress, incentivesReceiver, collateralJoin);
 *   ```
 * - **Parameter Modification**: Update global or contract-level parameters.
 *   ```solidity
 *   liquidationEngine.modifyParameters("GlobalLiquidationLimit", newLimit);
 *   liquidationEngine.modifyParameters("liquidator", newExchangeAddress);
 *   ```
 * - **Disabling**: Disable the contract to halt liquidations.
 *   ```solidity
 *   liquidationEngine.disableContract();
 *   ```
 * @custom:security Only authorized accounts (DAO, Admin, DisablerAccess, LiquidationAccess) can call state-changing functions.
 *                 Liquidations require sufficient limits and valid safety prices. Rewards are calculated to incentivize liquidators.
 * @custom:changes Renamed from Dog.sol to LiquidationEngine.sol. Replaced auction houses with Exchange module. Added global
 *                 liquidator and reward. Used SuAuthenticated for access control. Moved struct to ILiquidationEngine.
 * @custom:events Emits `AddAuthorization`, `DisableContract`, `ModifyParameters`, `LiquidateCDP`, `ReduceActiveLiquidationAmount`.
 */
contract LiquidationEngine is SuAuthenticated, ILiquidationEngine, Math {
    /// @notice Reference to the SafeEngine contract for Safe operations.
    ISafeEngine public safeEngine; // CDP Engine

    /// @notice Maps collateral types to their liquidation configurations.
    mapping (bytes32 => CollateralType) public collateralTypes;

    /// @notice Reference to the AccountingEngine for debt queuing.
    IAccountingEngine public accountingEngine; // Debt Engine
    /// @notice Maximum StablePro debt for active auctions [rad].
    uint256 public GlobalLiquidationLimit; // Max StablePro needed to cover debt+fees of active auctions [rad]
    /// @notice Current StablePro debt for active auctions [rad].
    uint256 public ActiveLiquidationAmount; // Amt StablePro needed to cover debt+fees of active auctions [rad]
    /// @notice Reward percentage for liquidators [wad].
    uint256 public LiquidatorReward; // Reward in percent (1e18 == 1) for liquidation [wad]
    /// @notice Address of the Exchange module for auctions.
    address public liquidator; // Liquidator, Exchange module
    /// @notice Discount type for liquidation auctions (e.g., 0 for aggressive).
    uint8 public liquidationDiscountType; // DiscountType, that will be used in liquidations

    // --- Init ---
    /**
     * @notice Initializes the LiquidationEngine with access control and SafeEngine addresses.
     * @dev Sets the SafeEngine reference, enables the contract, and sets default discount type.
     *      Emits a placeholder authorization event (can be removed).
     * @param accessControl Address of the access control singleton.
     * @param safeEngine_ Address of the SafeEngine contract.
     */
    function initialize(address accessControl, address safeEngine_) initializer public {

        __suAuthenticatedInit(accessControl);

        safeEngine = ISafeEngine(safeEngine_);
        contractEnabled = 1;
        liquidationDiscountType = 0; // Aggressive
        emit AddAuthorization(msg.sender);
    }

    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor
    constructor() {
        _disableInitializers();
    }

    // --- Disable ---
    /// @notice Flag indicating if the contract is enabled (1) or disabled (0).
    uint public contractEnabled;

    /**
     * @notice Disables the contract, halting liquidations.
     * @dev Sets `contractEnabled` to 0 and emits a placeholder event. Only callable by DisablerAccess.
     */
    function disableContract() external onlyDisablerAccess {
        contractEnabled = 0;
        emit DisableContract();
    }

    // --- Administration ---
    /**
     * @notice Modifies contract addresses.
     * @dev Updates AccountingEngine or Exchange module address. Only callable by DAO.
     * @param what Parameter to modify ("accountingEngine" or "liquidator").
     * @param data New contract address.
     */
    function modifyParameters(bytes32 what, address data) external onlyDAO {
        if (what == "accountingEngine") accountingEngine = IAccountingEngine(data);
        else if (what == "liquidator") liquidator = data;
        else revert("LiquidationEngine/file-unrecognized-param");
        emit ModifyParameters(what, data);
    }

    /**
     * @notice Modifies global parameters.
     * @dev Updates global liquidation limit or liquidator reward. Only callable by DAO.
     * @param what Parameter to modify ("GlobalLiquidationLimit" or "LiquidatorReward").
     * @param data New parameter value.
     */
    function modifyParameters(bytes32 what, uint256 data) external onlyDAO {
        if (what == "GlobalLiquidationLimit") GlobalLiquidationLimit = data;
        else if (what == "LiquidatorReward") LiquidatorReward = data;
        else revert("LiquidationEngine/file-unrecognized-param");
        emit ModifyParameters(what, data);
    }

    /**
     * @notice Modifies collateral type parameters.
     * @dev Updates liquidation penalty or limit for a collateral type. Only callable by DAO.
     * @param collateralType Unique identifier for the collateral type.
     * @param what Parameter to modify ("liquidationPenalty" or "liquidationLimit").
     * @param data New parameter value.
     */
    function modifyParameters(bytes32 collateralType, bytes32 what, uint256 data) external onlyDAO {
        if (what == "liquidationPenalty") {
            require(data >= WAD, "LiquidationEngine/file-liquidationPenalty-lt-WAD");
            collateralTypes[collateralType].liquidationPenalty = data;
        } else if (what == "liquidationLimit") collateralTypes[collateralType].liquidationLimit = data;
        else revert("LiquidationEngine/file-unrecognized-param");
        emit ModifyParameters(collateralType, what, data);
    }

    /**
     * @notice Retrieves the liquidation penalty for a collateral type.
     * @param collateralType Unique identifier for the collateral type.
     * @return Liquidation penalty [wad].
     */
    function liquidationPenalty(bytes32 collateralType) external view returns (uint256) {
        return collateralTypes[collateralType].liquidationPenalty;
    }

    /**
     * @notice Sets the discount type for liquidation auctions.
     * @dev Updates the auction discount type. Only callable by Admin.
     * @param newDiscountType New discount type (e.g., 0 for aggressive).
     */
    function setLiquidationDiscountType(uint8 newDiscountType) external onlyAdmin {
        liquidationDiscountType = newDiscountType;
    }

    /**
     * @notice Liquidates an undercollateralized Safe.
     * @dev Confiscates collateral and debt, rewards the liquidator, and auctions remaining collateral via Exchange.
     *      Pushes debt to AccountingEngine. Ensures limits and safety conditions are met.
     * @param collateralType Unique identifier for the collateral type.
     * @param cdp Address of the Safe to liquidate.
     * @param incentivesReceiver Address to receive liquidator reward.
     * @param collateralJoin Address of the CollateralJoin contract.
     * @return id Unique identifier of the Exchange order.
     */
    function liquidateCDP(
        bytes32 collateralType,
        address cdp,
        address incentivesReceiver,
        address collateralJoin
    ) external returns (uint256 id) {
        require(contractEnabled == 1, "LiquidationEngine/not-contractEnabled");

        safeEngine.updateSafetyPrice(collateralType);
        (uint256 collateralAmount, uint256 generatedDebt) = safeEngine.safes(collateralType, cdp);
        CollateralType memory _cType = collateralTypes[collateralType];
        uint256 deltaGeneratedDebt;
        uint256 accumulatedRate;
        uint256 debtFloor;
        {
            uint256 safetyPrice;
            (, accumulatedRate,, debtFloor, safetyPrice,,,) = safeEngine.collateralTypes(collateralType);
            // collateralAmount - 1e18, safetyPrice - 1e27, generatedDebt - 1e18, accumulatedRate - 1e27
            require(
                safetyPrice > 0 && _mul(collateralAmount, safetyPrice) < _mul(generatedDebt, accumulatedRate),
                "LiquidationEngine/not-unsafe"
            );

            // Get the minimum value between:
            // 1) Remaining space in the general GlobalLiquidationLimit
            // 2) Remaining space in the collateral liquidationLimit
            require(
                GlobalLiquidationLimit > ActiveLiquidationAmount
                    && _cType.liquidationLimit > _cType.activeLiquidationAmount,
                "LiquidationEngine/liquidation-limit-hit"
            );
            uint256 room = min(
                GlobalLiquidationLimit - ActiveLiquidationAmount,
                _cType.liquidationLimit - _cType.activeLiquidationAmount
            );

            // uint256.max()/(RAD*WAD) = 115,792,089,237,316
            deltaGeneratedDebt = min(generatedDebt, _mul(room, WAD) / accumulatedRate / _cType.liquidationPenalty);

            // Partial liquidation edge case logic
            if (generatedDebt > deltaGeneratedDebt) {
                if (_mul(generatedDebt - deltaGeneratedDebt, accumulatedRate) < debtFloor) {

                    // If the leftover Vault would be dusty, just liquidate it entirely.
                    // This will result in at least one of activeLiquidationAmount_i > liquidationLimit_i or
                    // ActiveLiquidationAmount > GlobalLiquidationLimit becoming true.
                    // The amount of excess will be bounded above by ceiling(debtFloor_i * liquidationPenalty_i / WAD).
                    // This deviation is assumed to be small compared to both liquidationLimit_i and
                    // GlobalLiquidationLimit, so that the extra amount of target StablePro over the limits
                    // intended is not of economic concern.
                    deltaGeneratedDebt = generatedDebt;
                } else {

                    // In a partial liquidation, the resulting auction should also be non-dusty.
                    require(
                        _mul(deltaGeneratedDebt, accumulatedRate) >= debtFloor,
                        "LiquidationEngine/dusty-auction-from-partial-liquidation"
                    );
                }
            }
        }

        uint256 deltaCollateral = _mul(collateralAmount, deltaGeneratedDebt) / generatedDebt;

        require(deltaCollateral > 0, "LiquidationEngine/null-auction");
        require(deltaGeneratedDebt <= 2**255 && deltaCollateral <= 2**255, "LiquidationEngine/overflow");

        uint256 rewardCollateral = _mul(deltaCollateral, LiquidatorReward) / WAD;
        uint256 collateral2sell = _sub(deltaCollateral, rewardCollateral);
        safeEngine.confiscateSAFECollateralAndDebt(
            collateralType, cdp, incentivesReceiver, address(accountingEngine), -int256(rewardCollateral), 0
        );
        safeEngine.confiscateSAFECollateralAndDebt(
            collateralType,
            cdp,
            liquidator,
            address(accountingEngine),
            -int256(collateral2sell),
            -int256(deltaGeneratedDebt)
        );

        uint256 due = _mul(deltaGeneratedDebt, accumulatedRate);
        accountingEngine.pushDebtToQueue(due);

        {   // Avoid stack too deep
            // This calcuation will overflow if deltaGeneratedDebt*rate exceeds ~10^14
            uint256 amountToRaise = _mul(due, _cType.liquidationPenalty) / WAD;
            ActiveLiquidationAmount = _add(ActiveLiquidationAmount, amountToRaise);
            collateralTypes[collateralType].activeLiquidationAmount =
                            _add(_cType.activeLiquidationAmount, amountToRaise);

            /// Now we nee to use our "auction" with Exchange module, that mean we need to add order
            /// id is needed only for event, so it's not necessary to store it
            /// But we don't use amountToRaise (=minAmount), so in future we may need to use it
            /// Also we send some tokens to incentivesReceiver previously, so we don't need it more
//            id = AuctionLike(_cType.liquidator).startAuction({
//                debt: amountToRaise,
//                collateralToSell: deltaCollateral,
//                colReceiver: cdp,
//                incentivesReceiver: incentivesReceiver
//            });

            id = IExchange(liquidator).addOrder(
                address(ICollateralJoin(collateralJoin).collateral()),
                collateral2sell,
                accountingEngine.stablecoinToSwap(),
                address(accountingEngine),
                liquidationDiscountType,
                collateralJoin
            );
        }

        emit LiquidateCDP(collateralType, cdp, deltaCollateral, deltaGeneratedDebt, due, liquidator, id);
    }


    /**
     * @notice Reduces active liquidation amounts after an auction completes.
     * @dev Updates global and collateral-specific liquidation amounts. Only callable by LiquidationAccess.
     * @param collateralType Unique identifier for the collateral type.
     * @param rad Amount to reduce [rad].
     */
    function reduceActiveLiquidationAmount(bytes32 collateralType, uint256 rad) external onlyLiquidationAccess {
        ActiveLiquidationAmount = _sub(ActiveLiquidationAmount, rad);
        collateralTypes[collateralType].activeLiquidationAmount =
                        _sub(collateralTypes[collateralType].activeLiquidationAmount, rad);
        emit ReduceActiveLiquidationAmount(collateralType, rad);
    }
}

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

/**
 * @title IAccountingEngine
 **/
interface IAccountingEngine {
    /* ==================== EVENTS ===============-===== */
    event StableProSwapped(uint256 amount);
    event DisableContract();
    event StablecoinRefilled(address stablecoin, uint256 amount);

    /* ==================== ERRORS ===============-===== */
    error ContractDisabled();
    error BadModifyParameters();
    error BadStablecoin(address asset);
    error BadRewardToken();
    error DebtNotZero();
    error SurplusNotZero();
    error InsufficientDebt();
    error InsufficientSurplus();
    error NotEnoughAsh();
    error PopDebtDelayNotFinished();
    error StablecoinNotExist(address asset);
    error StablecoinExists(address asset);

    /* ====================== VARS ===================== */

    function stablecoinToSwap() external view returns (address);

    /* ==================== MUTABLE METHODS ==================== */

    /**
     * @notice Push debt (that the system tries to cover with collateral auctions) to a queue
     * @dev Debt is locked in a queue to give the system enough time to auction collateral
     *      and gather surplus
     * @param amountToRaise Amount of debt to push
     */
    function pushDebtToQueue(uint amountToRaise) external;

    /**
     * @notice A block of debt can be popped from the queue after popDebtDelay seconds passed since it was
     *         added there
     * @param era Timestamp of the block of debt that should be popped out
     */
    function popDebtFromQueue(uint era) external;

    // Debt settlement
    /**
     * @notice Destroy an equal amount of coins and debt
     * @dev We can only destroy debt that is not locked in the queue and also not in a debt auction
     * @param rad Amount of coins/debt to destroy (number with 45 decimals)
    **/
    function settleDebt(uint rad) external;

    /**
     * @notice Use surplus coins to destroy debt that is/was in a debt auction
     * @param rad Amount of coins/debt to destroy (number with 45 decimals)
    **/
    function cancelAuctionedDebtWithSurplus(uint rad) external;

    /**
     * @notice Start a debt auction (we have debt = x$, token2sell with value of y$, where y >= x)
     * @dev We can only auction debt that is not already being auctioned and is not locked in the debt queue.
     * Firstly, we should donate token2sell (it's collateral or stablecoin) by refillStablecoin
    **/
    function auctionDebt(
        address token2sell,
        uint256 amountToSell,
        uint8 discountType,
        uint256 auctionDebt
    ) external returns (uint orderId);

    /**
     * @notice Start a surplus auction
     * @dev We can only auction surplus if we wait at least 'surplusAuctionDelay' seconds since the last
     *      auction trigger, if we keep enough surplus in the buffer and if there is no bad debt to settle
    **/
    function auctionSurplus(uint256 surplusAmount, uint8 discountType) external returns (uint orderId);

    /**
     * @notice Disable this contract (normally called by Global Settlement)
     * @dev When we disable, the contract tries to settle as much debt as possible (if there's any) with
            any surplus that's left in the system. After erasing debt, the contract will either transfer any
            remaining surplus right away (if disableCooldown == 0) or will only record the timestamp when
            it was disabled
    **/
    function disableContract() external;

    /* ================= Stablecoin Whitelist ================== */

    /**
     * @notice Add new stablecoin to whitelist of stablecoins protocol works with
    **/
    function addWhitelistStablecoin(address stablecoin) external;

    /**
     * @notice Remove stablecoin from whitelist of stablecoins protocol works with
    **/
    function removeWhitelistStablecoin(address stablecoin) external;

    /**
     * @notice Check if give token is in stablecoins whitelist
    **/
    function hasWhitelistStablecoin(address stablecoin) external view returns (bool);

    /**
     * @notice Change var stablecoinToSwap, that is used in liquidation process
    **/
    function setStablecoinToSwap(address stablecoin) external;

    /* =================== MANUAL FUNCTIONS ==================== */
    /**
     * @notice Admin function to join protocol using real StablePro (= join in coinJoin)
    **/
    function joinStablePro(uint256 amount) external;

    /**
     * @notice Admin function to get real StablePro tokens instead of records in protocol (= exit from coinJoin)
    **/
    function getRealStablePro(uint256 amount) external;

    /**
     * @notice Function to send stablecoin to AccountingEngine contract
    **/
    function refillStablecoin(address stablecoin, uint256 amount) external;

    /**
     * @notice Admin function to distribute surplus after getting it
    **/
    //function distributeSurplus(uint256 amount) external;

    /**
     * @notice Function to swap sender's stablePro to stablecoin that is in whitelist
    **/
    function swapStableProToStablecoin(address stablecoinToken, uint256 stableProAmountE18) external;
}

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

import "@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Metadata.sol";
import {IDisable} from "./IDisable.sol";

/**
 * @title ITaxCollector
 **/
interface ICollateralJoin is IDisable {

    /* ===================== EVENTS ===================== */

    event Join(address indexed usr, uint256 wad);
    event Exit(address indexed usr, uint256 wad);

    /* ====================== VARS ===================== */
    function decimals() external returns (uint);
    function collateral() external view returns(IERC20Metadata);

    /* ==================== METHODS ==================== */

    /**
    * @notice Join collateral in the system
    * @param usr Account from which we transferFrom collateral and add it in the system
    * @param wad Amount of collateral to transfer in the system (represented as a number with 18 decimals)
    **/
    function join(address usr, uint wad) external;

    /**
    * @notice Exit collateral from the system
    * @param usr Account to which we transfer the collateral
    * @param wad Amount of collateral to transfer to 'account' (represented as a number with 18 decimals)
    **/
    function exit(address usr, uint wad) external;
}

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

/**
 * @title ITaxCollector
 **/
interface ILiquidationEngine {
    /* ==================== STRUCTS ==================== */

    struct CollateralType {
        uint256 liquidationPenalty;  // Liquidation Penalty [wad]
        uint256 liquidationLimit;  // Max StablePro needed to cover debt+fees of active auctions per cType [rad]
        uint256 activeLiquidationAmount;  // Amt StablePro needed to cover debt+fees of active auctions per cType [rad]
    }

    /* ==================== EVENTS ===============-===== */

    event DisableContract();

    event AddAuthorization(address indexed usr);
    event RemoveAuthorization(address indexed usr);

    event ModifyParameters(bytes32 indexed what, uint256 data);
    event ModifyParameters(bytes32 indexed what, address data);
    event ModifyParameters(bytes32 indexed collateralType, bytes32 indexed what, uint256 data);
    event ModifyParameters(bytes32 indexed collateralType, bytes32 indexed what, address liquidator);

    event LiquidateCDP(
        bytes32 indexed collateralType,
        address indexed cdp,
        uint256 lockedCollateral,
        uint256 generatedDebt,
        uint256 due,
        address liquidator,
        uint256 indexed id
    );
    event ReduceActiveLiquidationAmount(bytes32 indexed collateralType, uint256 rad);

    /* ==================== MUTABLE METHODS ==================== */

    // --- Administration ---
    function modifyParameters(bytes32 what, uint data) external;
    function modifyParameters(bytes32 what, address data) external;
    function modifyParameters(bytes32 collateralType, bytes32 what, uint data) external;

    function setLiquidationDiscountType(uint8 newDiscountType) external;

    /**
      * @notice Liquidate a Vault and start a Dutch auction to sell its collateral for StablePro.
      * @dev The entire Vault will be liquidated except when the target amount of StablePro to be raised in
      * the resulting auction (debt of Vault + liquidation penalty) causes either ActiveLiquidationAmount to exceed
      * GlobalLiquidationLimit or collateralType.activeLiquidationAmount to exceed collateralType.liquidationLimit
      * by an economically significant amount. In that case, a partial liquidation is performed to respect the global
      * and per-collateralType limits on outstanding StablePro target. The one exception is if the resulting auction
      * would likely have too little collateral to be interesting to Keepers
      * (debt taken from Vault < collateralType.debtFloor),
      * in which case the function reverts. Please refer to the code and comments within if more detail is desired.
      * @param collateralType - collateral type
      * @param cdp - address of cdp position
      * @param incentivesReceiver - address that will receive the liquidation reward, if any.
      * @param collateralJoin - address of collateral adapter
    **/
    function liquidateCDP(
        bytes32 collateralType,
        address cdp,
        address incentivesReceiver,
        address collateralJoin
    ) external returns (uint256 id);

    function reduceActiveLiquidationAmount(bytes32 collateralType, uint256 rad) external;

    /* ==================== VIEW METHODS ==================== */

    function liquidationPenalty(bytes32 collateralType) external view returns (uint256);
}

// TODO: check how to operate with license and use one for all contracts

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

import "./IDisable.sol";

/**
 * @title SafeEngine
 * @notice The single source of truth for the Maker Protocol. It contains the accounting system of the core Vault,
 * Internal StablePro balances, and collateral state. It houses the public interface for Vault management,
 * allowing safe(= CDP or Vault) owners to adjust their Vault state balances. It also contains the public interface
 * for Vault fungibility, allowing safe (Vault) owners to transfer, split, and merge Vaults.
 * Excluding these interfaces, SAFEEngine is accessed through trusted smart contract modules.
 **/
interface ISafeEngine is IDisable {
    /* ==================== METHODS ==================== */

    // --- Data ---
    struct CollateralType {
        uint256 debtAmount;        // Total debt issued for this specific collateral type                          [wad]
        uint256 accumulatedRate;   // Accumulator for interest accrued on this collateral type                     [ray]
        uint256 debtCeiling;       // Maximum amount of debt that can be generated with this collateral type       [rad]
        uint256 debtFloor;         // Minimum amount of debt that must be generated by a CDP using this collateral [rad]
        uint256 safetyPrice;       // Floor price at which a CDP is allowed to generate debt                       [ray]
        uint256 liquidationRatio;  // Liquidation ratio to calculate safety price                                  [ray]
        address collateralAddress; // Address of collateral
        uint256 safetyPriceBlockNumber; // Block when safetyPrice was updated
    }
    struct SAFE {
        uint256 lockedCollateral; // Total amount of collateral locked in a SAFE/CDP  [wad]
        uint256 generatedDebt;    // Total amount of debt generated by a SAFE/CDP     [wad]
    }

    // --- VARS ---

    function safes(bytes32, address) external view returns (uint, uint);

    function collateralTypes(bytes32) external view returns (
        uint256 debtAmount,       // [wad]
        uint256 accumulatedRate,  // [ray]
        uint256 debtCeiling,      // [rad]
        uint256 debtFloor,        // [rad]
        uint256 safetyPrice,      // [ray]
        uint256 liquidationRatio, // [ray]
        address collateralAddress,
        uint256 safetyPriceBlockNumber
);

    function tokenCollateral(bytes32, address) external view returns (uint256);

    function coinBalance(address) external view returns (uint256);

    function debtBalance(address) external view returns (uint256);

    function cdpRights(address, address) external view returns (uint256);

    function globalDebtCeiling() external view returns (uint256);

    function globalDebt() external view returns (uint256);

    // --- Auth ---
    /**
     * @notice Allow an address to modify your CDP.
     * For example coinAdapter should be able to modify your CDP to withdraw all correctly.
     * @param usr Account to give CDP permissions to
     */
    function approveSAFEModification(address usr) external;

    /**
     * @notice Deny an address the rights to modify your CDP
     * @param usr Account to give CDP permissions to
     */
    function denySAFEModification(address usr) external;

    // --- Administration ---

    function initializeCollateralType(bytes32 collateralType, address collateralAddress) external;

    /**
     * @notice Method to modify some global variables
     * @param what - name of variable we want to change
     * @param data - new value of this variable
     */
    function modifyParameters(bytes32 what, uint data) external;
    /**
     * @notice Method to modify values in struct of collateralTypes
     * @param collateralType - collateral type we want to modify (collateralTypes[collateralType])
     * @param what - name of variable in struct we want to change
     * @param data - new value of this variable
     */
    function modifyParameters(bytes32 collateralType, bytes32 what, uint data) external;

    // --- Fungibility ---
    function modifyCollateralBalance(bytes32 collateralType, address usr, int256 wad) external;
    function transferCollateral(bytes32 collateralType, address src, address dst, uint256 wad) external;
    function transferInternalCoins(address src, address dst, uint256 rad) external;

    // --- SafetyPrice Manipulation ---
    /**
     * @notice Method to update safetyPrice, it's called each time, when function need actual safetyPrice
     * @param collateralType - safetyPrice's collateral type we want to update
     */
    function updateSafetyPrice(bytes32 collateralType) external;

    // --- CDP Manipulation ---
    /**
     * @notice Add/remove collateral or put back/generate more debt in a CDP
     * @param collateralType Type of collateral to withdraw/deposit in and from the CDP
     * @param cdp Target CDP
     * @param collateralSource Account we take collateral from/put collateral into
     * @param debtDestination Account from which we credit/debit coins and debt
     * @param deltaCollateral Amount of collateral added/extract from the CDP
     * @param deltaDebt Amount of debt to generate/repay
     */
    function modifySAFECollateralization(
        bytes32 collateralType,
        address cdp,
        address collateralSource,
        address debtDestination,
        int deltaCollateral,
        int deltaDebt
    ) external;

    // --- CDP Fungibility ---
    /**
     * @notice Transfer collateral and/or debt between CDPs
     * @param collateralType Collateral type transferred between CDPs
     * @param src Source CDP
     * @param dst Destination CDP
     * @param deltaCollateral Amount of collateral to take/add into src and give/take from dst
     * @param deltaDebt Amount of debt to take/add into src and give/take from dst
     */
    function transferSAFECollateralAndDebt(
        bytes32 collateralType,
        address src,
        address dst,
        int deltaCollateral,
        int deltaDebt
    ) external;

    // --- CDP Confiscation ---
    /**
     * @notice Normally used by the LiquidationEngine in order to confiscate collateral and
       debt from a CDP and give them to someone else
     * @param collateralType Collateral type the CDP has locked inside
     * @param cdp Target CDP
     * @param collateralCounterparty Who we take/give collateral to
     * @param debtCounterparty Who we take/give debt to
     * @param deltaCollateral Amount of collateral taken/added into the CDP
     * @param deltaDebt Amount of debt taken/added into the CDP
     */
    function confiscateSAFECollateralAndDebt(
        bytes32 collateralType,
        address cdp,
        address collateralCounterparty,
        address debtCounterparty,
        int deltaCollateral,
        int deltaDebt
    ) external;

    // --- Settlement ---
    /**
     * @notice Nullify an amount of coins with an equal amount of debt
     * @param rad Amount of debt & coins to destroy (expressed as a number with 45 decimals)
     */
    function settleDebt(uint rad) external;

    /**
     * @notice Usually called by CoinSavingsAccount in order to create unbacked debt
     * @param debtDestination Usually AccountingEngine that can settle decreaseSoldAmount with surplus
     * @param coinDestination Usually CoinSavingsAccount who passes the new coins to depositors
     * @param rad Amount of debt to create (expressed as a number with 45 decimals)
     */
    function createUnbackedDebt(address debtDestination, address coinDestination, uint rad) external;

    // --- Rates ---
    /**
     * @notice Usually called by TaxCollector in order to accrue interest on a specific collateral type
     * @param collateralType Collateral type we accrue interest for
     * @param surplusDst Destination for amount of surplus created by applying the interest rate
       to debt created by CDPs with 'collateralType'
     * @param accumulatedRate Multiplier applied to the debtAmount in order to calculate the surplus
     */
    function updateAccumulatedRate(bytes32 collateralType, address surplusDst, int accumulatedRate) external;
}
","keccak256":"0x005803105e8f4777342c15159835863376d16f95f909489af8c58894931530bf","license":"UNLICENSED"},"contracts/makerdao/utils/Math.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-or-later

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

abstract contract Math {
    uint256 constant ONE = 10 ** 27;
    uint256 constant WAD = 10 ** 18;

    /**
    * @notice Calculates the sum of an unsigned integer and a signed integer
    * @param  x Unsigned integer
    * @param  y Signed integer
    * @return z Unsigned sum of `x` and `y`
    */
    function _add(uint x, int y) internal pure returns (uint z) {
        if (y >= 0) {
            z = x + uint256(y);
        } else {
            z = x - uint256(-y);
        }
        require(y >= 0 || z <= x);
        require(y <= 0 || z >= x);
    }

    /**
    * @notice Calculates the substraction of an unsigned integer and a signed integer
    * @param  x Unsigned integer
    * @param  y Signed integer
    * @return z Unsigned substraction of `x` and `y`
    */
    function _sub(uint x, int y) internal pure returns (uint z) {
        if (y >= 0) {
            z = x - uint256(y);
        } else {
            z = x + uint256(-y);
        }
        require(y <= 0 || z <= x);
        require(y >= 0 || z >= x);
    }
    function _mul(uint x, int y) internal pure returns (int z) {
        z = int(x) * y;
        require(int(x) >= 0);
        require(y == 0 || z / y == int(x));
    }

    function _rdiv(uint x, uint y) internal pure returns (uint z) {
        z = _mul(x, ONE) / y;
    }

    function _add(uint x, uint y) internal pure returns (uint z) {
        require((z = x + y) >= x);
    }
    function _sub(uint x, uint y) internal pure returns (uint z) {
        require((z = x - y) <= x);
    }
    function _mul(uint x, uint y) internal pure returns (uint z) {
        require(y == 0 || (z = x * y) / y == x);
    }

    function min(uint256 x, uint256 y) internal pure returns (uint256 z) {
        z = x <= y ? x : y;
    }

    function either(bool x, bool y) internal pure returns (bool z) {
        assembly{ z := or(x, y)}
    }
    function both(bool x, bool y) internal pure returns (bool z) {
        assembly{ z := and(x, y)}
    }
}

devdoc.custom:changes: Renamed from Dog.sol to LiquidationEngine.sol. Replaced auction houses with Exchange module. Added global                 liquidator and reward. Used SuAuthenticated for access control. Moved struct to ILiquidationEngine.
devdoc.custom:security: Only authorized accounts (DAO, Admin, DisablerAccess, LiquidationAccess) can call state-changing functions.                 Liquidations require sufficient limits and valid safety prices. Rewards are calculated to incentivize liquidators.
devdoc.custom:usage: - **Initialization**: Deploy with access control and SafeEngine addresses.   ```solidity   LiquidationEngine liquidationEngine = new LiquidationEngine(accessControl, safeEngine);   ``` - **Collateral Type Setup**: Configure liquidation parameters for a collateral type.   ```solidity   liquidationEngine.modifyParameters("ETH-A", "liquidationPenalty", penalty);   liquidationEngine.modifyParameters("ETH-A", "liquidationLimit", limit);   ``` - **Liquidation**: Liquidate an undercollateralized Safe.   ```solidity   uint orderId = liquidationEngine.liquidateCDP("ETH-A", safeAddress, incentivesReceiver, collateralJoin);   ``` - **Parameter Modification**: Update global or contract-level parameters.   ```solidity   liquidationEngine.modifyParameters("GlobalLiquidationLimit", newLimit);   liquidationEngine.modifyParameters("liquidator", newExchangeAddress);   ``` - **Disabling**: Disable the contract to halt liquidations.   ```solidity   liquidationEngine.disableContract();   ```
devdoc.details: Identifies undercollateralized Safes, confiscates collateral and debt, and auctions collateral via the Exchange      module. Supports global and per-collateral-type liquidation limits, a liquidator reward, and a discount type for      auctions. Integrates with SafeEngine for Safe operations and AccountingEngine for debt queuing. This contract is a      fork of MakerDAO’s Dog.sol, adapted for StableUnit with Exchange-based auctions and a global liquidator.

disableContract().details: Sets `contractEnabled` to 0 and emits a placeholder event. Only callable by DisablerAccess.

initialize(address,address).details: Sets the SafeEngine reference, enables the contract, and sets default discount type.      Emits a placeholder authorization event (can be removed).

params.accessControl: Address of the access control singleton.

liquidateCDP(bytes32,address,address,add.details: Confiscates collateral and debt, rewards the liquidator, and auctions remaining collateral via Exchange.      Pushes debt to AccountingEngine. Ensures limits and safety conditions are met.

params.cdp: Address of the Safe to liquidate.
params.collateralType: Unique identifier for the collateral type.

returns.id: Unique identifier of the Exchange order.

params.collateralType: Unique identifier for the collateral type.

modifyParameters(bytes32,address).details: Updates AccountingEngine or Exchange module address. Only callable by DAO.

modifyParameters(bytes32,bytes32,uint256.details: Updates liquidation penalty or limit for a collateral type. Only callable by DAO.

params.collateralType: Unique identifier for the collateral type.

modifyParameters(bytes32,uint256).details: Updates global liquidation limit or liquidator reward. Only callable by DAO.

reduceActiveLiquidationAmount(bytes32,ui.details: Updates global and collateral-specific liquidation amounts. Only callable by LiquidationAccess.

params.collateralType: Unique identifier for the collateral type.

setLiquidationDiscountType(uint8).details: Updates the auction discount type. Only callable by Admin.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.
